SEARCH
Module org.junit.platform.engine
Package org.junit.platform.engine.support.discovery

Interface DiscoveryIssueReporter.Condition<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Consumer<T>, Predicate<T>
Enclosing interface:
DiscoveryIssueReporter
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public static interface DiscoveryIssueReporter.Condition<T> extends Predicate<T>, Consumer<T>
A Condition is a union of Predicate and Consumer.

Instances of this type may be used as Predicates or Consumers. For example, a Condition may be passed to Stream.filter(Predicate) if it is used for filtering, or to Stream.peek(Consumer) if it is only used for reporting or other side effects.

See Also:
  • DiscoveryIssueReporter.createReportingCondition(Predicate, Function)

  • Method Details

    • allOf

      @SafeVarargs static <T> DiscoveryIssueReporter.Condition<T> allOf(DiscoveryIssueReporter.Condition<? super T>... conditions)
      Return a composed condition that represents a logical AND of the supplied conditions without short-circuiting.

      All of the supplied conditions will be evaluated even if one or more of them return false to ensure that all issues are reported.

      Parameters:
      conditions - the conditions to compose; never null, not empty, and must not contain any null elements
      Returns:
      the composed condition; never null

    • accept

      default void accept(T value)
      Evaluate the #test(Object) method of this condition to potentially report an issue.
